member.name: P:TechTalk.SpecFlow.HookAttribute.Order
member.summary: The order in which the hook will be executed. Lower numbers go first. Orders are only applicable for hooks of the same type. Hooks with the same priority will have non-deterministic execution order. Default value is 10,000.

member.name: M:TechTalk.SpecFlow.BeforeTestRunAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new BeforeTestRunAttribute with a default Order of 10000

member.summary: Specifies a hook to be executed before each scenario. This attribute is a synonym to .

member.name: T:TechTalk.SpecFlow.AfterScenarioAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a hook to be executed after each scenario.

member.name: T:TechTalk.SpecFlow.AfterAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a hook to be executed after each scenario. This attribute is a synonym to .

member.name: T:TechTalk.SpecFlow.Infrastructure.ContextManager.StackedInternalContextManager`1
member.summary: Implementation of internal context manager which keeps a stack of contexts, rather than a single one. This allows the contexts to be used when a new context is created before the previous context has been completed which is what happens when a step calls other steps. This means that the step contexts will be reported correctly even when there is a nesting of steps calling steps calling steps.
member.typeparam: A type derived from SpecFlowContext, which needs to be managed in a way

member.name: P:TechTalk.SpecFlow.Infrastructure.ContextManager.CurrentTopLevelStepDefinitionType
member.summary: Holds the StepDefinitionType of the last step that was executed from the actual featrure file, excluding the types of the steps that were executed during the calling of a step

member.name: T:TechTalk.SpecFlow.Infrastructure.ITestObjectResolver
member.summary: Resolves user created test objects from different scopes (scenario, feature, test thread).

remarks.para: The test objects might be dependent on particular SpecFlow infrastructure, therefore the implemented resolution logic should support resolving the following objects (from the provided SpecFlow container): , , and (to be able to resolve any other SpecFlow infrastucture). So basically the resolution of these classes has to be forwarded to the original container.
If the resolved (top level) object implements , the method must be called, passing in the original SpecFlow container. (The base class needs this.)

member.name: M:TechTalk.SpecFlow.ScenarioContext.GetBindingInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Called by SpecFlow infrastructure when an instance of a binding class is needed.
member.param: The type of the binding class.
member.remarks: The binding classes are the classes with the [Binding] attribute, that might contain step definitions, hooks or step argument transformations. The method is called when any binding method needs to be called.

member.name: T:TechTalk.SpecFlow.ScopeAttribute
member.summary: Restricts the binding attributes (step definition, hook, etc.) to be applied only in a specific scope.

member.name: T:TechTalk.SpecFlow.Tracing.IThreadSafeTraceListener
member.summary: Marker interface for trace listener that do not need queued execution
